subject: Investing
title: Prospect Theory and Framing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Prospect Theory and Framing.

hook.text: Would you prefer a sure $900 or a 90% chance of $1,000? Most people take the sure thingâ€”irrationally.

buildup.text: Prospect theory, by Kahneman and Tversky, showed people weigh gains and losses asymmetrically.

discovery.text: We are risk-averse with gains (take the sure win) and risk-seeking with losses (gamble to avoid a loss).

twist.text: Framing matters: describing a surgery as '90% survival' vs '10% death' changes patient decisions dramatically.

climax.text: Investors reframe losses as 'unrealized' to justify holding, turning prospect theory into real damage.

punchline.text: How a choice is framed changes what you choose. Be aware of the frame.

quiz.question: What does prospect theory predict about losses?
options: People become risk-seeking to avoid losses
